data.title: Advanced Quest Part 18
data.meta_description: Duration: May 29, 2024 18:00 JST ~Advanced Quest Part 18 Advanced Quests are quests to test your skills using only your Servants. (Special Party) They appear permanently in Chaldea Gate. You can attempt Advanced Quests anytime if you fulfill the requirements to unlock them. Rewards for clearing...
data.text:
Clear E Pluribus Unum

ソウル･グラトニー Soul Gluttony AP Cost Bond Points QP EXP Battlefield type 5 1,330

(266 per AP) 138,000

(27,600 per AP) 37,630

(7,526 per AP) City, Darkness

Enemies Battle 1/3 Soul Eater A

Lvl 33 46,992 HP

Soul Eater B

Lvl 31 44,170 HP

Soul Eater C

Lvl 32 45,581 HP Battle 2/3 Soul Eater A

Lvl 34 48,402 HP

Soul Eater A

Lvl 35 49,813 HP Fatal Battle 3/3 Soul Eater

Lvl 36 51,224 HP

Soul Gluttony*

Lvl 57 123,321 HP Notable Drops x3 x3

Tips & Tricks: Simple goal: defeat all the Soul Eater enemies in each wave. However, this quest relies on utilizing the HP Regen skills to pass this challenge. Highly recommended to bring in servants that grant HP Regen skills to others or themselves, since gimmick relies on this skill to bypass the enemies defensive buff. One other tip is to have the skills Debuff Immunity and/or the Remove Debuff since the Soul Gluttony immediatly inflicts the nasty debuff blockers and removers from your party.

(*The Soul Gluttony in Wave 3 will appear right after eliminating the Soul Eater and will end the players turn. Treat this little surprise as you would for Enemies with HP Break and expect the quest to go past 3 turns.)

Devour: All the Soul Eaters have this skill in their sets. It includes the following buffs:

Applies Attack Debuff vs. Units with non-healing buffs; Recovers 500 HP with each attack.

Applies Buff on Damage vs. Units with non-healing buffs; Recovers 500 HP from attacks.

Damage Resistance (70%) vs. Units with non-healing buffs (1 Time).

Binge Eating This is more improved version of the Devour skill that the Soul Gluttony has and will include these buffs as follow:

Applies Attack Debuff vs. Units with non-healing buffs; Recovers 2000 HP with each attack.

Applies Buff on Damage vs. Units with non-healing buffs; Recovers 2000 HP from attacks.

Damage Resistance (90%) vs. Units with non-healing buffs (5 Times).

When Soul Gluttony appears on the field, it will first activate the skills and inflict the following debuffs: has and will include these buffs as follow:

Knifes of Segregation Remove 3 effects vs. Buff Positive Effect starting from the latest one on all enemies.

Forks of Oppression Apply Buff Blocks vs. Buff Positive Effect on all enemies (3 Times).

Strategy: As mentioned above, only units buffed with HP Regen are the only ones that can bypass the enemies Damage Resistance buffs. For that much, deploy a few servants that can grant such skills to other servants that are planned to attacking the enemies. Here is a list of a few Servants that are highly recommended:

Servant Reason

Habetrot

Can give Female party members a long-lasting HP Regeneration effect.

Merlin, Hans Christian Andersen, Asclepius

Highly Recommended Supports

Supportive Casters who have NPs with HP Regeneration.

Asclepius can deal with the third wave's Buff Block with his third skill's debuff removal.

Arjuna (Alter)

3rd skill grants HP Regen to himself.

High firepower DPS.

The 3rd skill on its own doesn't give him a lot of uptime on its HP Regeneration, so caution is advised.

Nitocris (Alter), Spartacus

DPS options that have HP Regeneration on their skills.

Daikokuten

Highly Recommended DPS

First skill grants HP Regen to the entire party.

Several useful supportive effects.

Good DPS option against the Earth-attribute Soul Eaters.

Xuanzang Sanzang, Charles Babbage

High power Caster DPSs.

Xu Fu

Teamwide debuff removal on first skill is great for removing the Buff Block effect on wave 3.

NP gives herself a long-lasting HP Regeneration effect.

Completion

RewardCompletion

RewardClear all arrows for the first time to receive this reward

Clear Anastasia

忌避すべき実験 Experiment that is Ought to Be Shunned Against AP Cost Bond Points QP EXP Battlefield type 5 1,830

(2nd Form) Lvl 84 75,217 HP

(3rd Form) Lvl 90 135,217 HP Notable Drops x5 x5

Tips & Tricks

A few gimmicks to watch out for is the fact that the enemies all have different forms. How it works is that all of them are given unremovable Guts status Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable.. After at least killing one of them and they activate the Buff, they will activate another skill that will transition them to the forms and are given more additional buffs according to the forms. Looking at the Quest Body, at least each 2 enemies are limited to a certain number of transformations, so its all about trying to wittle them down, In addition, they gain a demerit called Price of Power, which hits them with Instant Death Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. on themselves after 3 turns. However, this isn't really much of a good outcome, for if the enemy still has a form to evolve to, then they will in turn wait for Death until the next transformation.

Important Note: When it becomes the Enemies turn, whatever form they are in currently (1st,2nd,3rd), the first time they are acting in their forms is when they will start applying alternate skills to either buff their side or debuff the other team. I say alternate because the AI randomizes between the form's skill and chooses only one to act on. But it only happens when it becomes the enemy's turn, meaning if the player manages to kill them off before they can act, then their skills won't activate. This means right on the player's 1st turn, make sure to have all the Vanguard row ready to fire off their AoE NP to eliminate the enemy's chances of buffing/debuffing anymore than their stages allow them.

Here is the skill list of each form to watch out for:

1st Form: Upon transformation

Price of Power lvl.1- Instant Death to self Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. after 3 turns (Demerit).

Applies Attack up Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (20%) on self (3t) (Stackable).

Applies Defense up Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (20%) on self (3t) (Stackable).

Applies NP gain Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (self) on self for one charge every turn (Stackable).

Enemy acts on turn:

(Option 1) Pyromancy Magecraft- Apply Burn (-500 HP) on all enemies (3t).

(Option 2) Barrier Magecraft- Apply Damage Cut (-5000) on party (1 Time, 3t).

Bullet Protection- Applies Taunt status to one party member that has not yet activated their Guts status Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (1t).

2nd Form: Upon transformation

Price of Power lvl.2- Instant Death to self Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. after 3 turns (Demerit).

Applies Max HP up Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (35,000 HP) on self (Stackable).

Applies HP Regen Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (5000 HP) on self (Stackable)

Applies Attack up Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (30%) on self (3t) (Stackable).

Applies Defense up Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (30%) on self (3t) (Stackable).

Applies NP gain Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. on self for one charge every turn (Stackable).

Enemy acts on turn:

(Option 1) Weakening Magecraft- Apply Damage Up (-300), NP Aquisition Rate Down (30%), and Star Drop Rate Down (30%) on all enemies (3t).

(Option 2) Heavy Drinker- Drains NP (20%) from enemy party, Charges one NP gauge to ally team.

Bullet Protection- Applies Taunt status to one party member that has not yet activated their Guts status Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (1t).

3rd Form: Upon transformation

Rampage- Removes Instant Death Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. on self.

Applies Healing power up Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (500%) on self.

Applies Attack up Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (50%) on self (5t) (Stackable).

Applies Defense up Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (50%) on self (5t) (Stackable).

Increases NP Charge by 5 on self.

Applies NP Damage up Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (30%) on self.

Applies Attack Down Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. on self, decreases by 10%/turn (Demerit).

Applies Defense Down Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. on self, decreases by 10%/turn (Demerit).

Enemy acts on turn:

(Option 1) Digestive Fluids- 3 times with 50% Chance to Remove 1 Buff Positive Effect starting from the latest one on all enemies.

(Option 2) Body Transformation- Applies Critical Rate Up (100%) on self (1 Time, 3t). Applies Attack Debuff that inflicts Paralysis on enemy for 1 turn (1 Time, 3t).

Strategy: Defeating the enemies here will take a while unless there is a way to constantly fire off AoE NP every chance there is. Fortunatly, this battle isn't one where you are hampered by enemies with HP bar breaks; this is one where Guts skills are activated, So it is better to have all Vanguards with AoE NP damage and fully charged on the 1st turn. Be mindful of which enemies are leftover as the ones with the 2nd and 3rd forms left alive on the field will inflict serious harm on the player with their debuffs, especially the 3rd form that has a chance of activating its Digestive Fluid ability and has a very good chance to one-shot one of the Servants with just one attack.

Clear Olympus

ヘラの栄光 Glory of Hera AP Cost Bond Points QP EXP Battlefield type 5 1,830

(366 per AP) 188,000

(37,600 per AP) 76,380

(15,276 per AP) Sunlight, Shore

Enemies Fatal Battle 1/1 Heracles

Lvl 80 200,860 HP Notable Drops x4 x4

Tips & Tricks

Face off against Heracles with his 12 Labors skills and the buffs that come with each turn. This Advanced Quest recreates the tales of Heracles' 12 Labors in chronological order. In addition, Heracles is granted Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. 11 Guts stacks. Along with the quest gimmicks, Heracles also has access to his Servant Skills (except for his 3rd skill) at level 8 and always has Mental Debuff Immunity Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. ( , . , ).

There are 2 win conditions to this fight:

- Survive for 12 turns until Heracles retreats by himself.

- Get through Heracles' Guts stacks and kill him.

Below is a list containing the skills that will be used every turn, in a set order.

Turn Activation of Skill Skill Description 1st turn (Start of Battle) Slayed the Nemean Lion

Gains 50% Defense up Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (3 turns, unremovable)

Applies Ignore Defense to self (3 turns, removable)

2nd turn Slayed the Lernaean Hydra

Inflicts Poison with 1k damage on all party members (3 turns, removable)

Gains On-Attack effect Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (permanent, unremovable); Upon landing a critical hit, inflicts Poison with 1k damage on one enemy (3 turns, removable) and inflicts a debuff on one enemy (3 turns, removable) that removes the latest buff from self and inflicts 10% Attack down (3 turns, removable) on self at the end of each turn.

3rd turn Captured the Ceryneia's Stag

Applies Debuff Immunity Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. vs. Immobilize Debuffs ( , . , ) on Self (4 times).

Applies Attack Debuff Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable.; When attacking, reduce the number of any defensive buff ( , , . , / / ) state by 1 (5T)

4th turn Captured the Erymanthian Boar

Reduces the attack power (20%) of all enemies (3T) and inflicts a debuff on all enemies that, after a turn, reduces defense (40%) (3T).

If Chiron is on the player team, Heracles will also debuff himself with Attack Down by 20% for 3 turns.

5th turn Clean the Augeias' Stable

Removes effects with Buff Increase Defence ( , , . , / / ) on all enemies.

Applies Buff Block vs. Positive Effect Buffs on all enemies (2 times/3T).

6th turn Slayed the Stymphalian Birds

Grants invincible pierce on Self (3T)

Critical rate up Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (20%) on Self (3T)

7th turn Captured the Cretan Bull

Increases Hercules' attack power (30%) on Self (3T).

Increases Critical power Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (40%) on Self (3T).

8th turn Stealing Diomedes' Man-Eating Horses

Applies Attack Debuff Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable.: When attacking, absorb target's HP (500 HP) + remove 1 debuff effect from Self (3T).

9th turn Obtained the Amazoness Queen's Belt

Applies NP charge Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. 1 per turn on Self (3T).

Applies NP Damage up Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (30%) on Self (3T).

10th turn Obtained Geryon's Bull

Increases Heracle's number of actions Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. by +2 (3T)

11th turn Stole the Golden Apples of Hesperides

Applies NP Seal to all enemies (1 turn)

Applies Skill Seal to all enemies (1 turn)

12th turn Captured Cerberus, the Guardian of the Underworld

Increases Hercules' NP charge to the max.

Applies Critical rate up Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. (100%) on Self (1 time/1 T)

Applies invincibility pierce on Self (2 times/1T)

List of effects triggered by Guts number[]

Guts Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. activates Removes all debuffs on self.

Applies 30% Quick / Arts / Buster resistance (2 turns) on self depending on the last attack type / / used before triggering the Guts.

Applies 15% Quick , Arts and Buster resistance on self if the last attack that triggered Guts was an Extra attack .

Guts Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. activated 6 times Berserker Roar

Inflicts defensive down (30%) on all enemies (5T)

Applies Debuff Immunity vs. Buffs Decrease damage on Self (3 times).

Guts Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. activated 9 times Unyielding Bravery

Grants Buster Up (30%) to Self (5T)

grants 2 NP charge when Guts is activated.

If EMIYA is on the player team, he'll give himself a buff that will reduce his skill cooldowns by 1 turn at the end of every turn.

Strategy:

Not much to do that either Attack and try to defeat Heracles 12 times with his 12 Labors ( Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. x11), or go for a strong Turtle defense, be warned as both methods come with risks to watch out for as failing to counter act them will leave you helpless halfway through the quest. For now, let's go over the methods.

Defeating Heracles; The Offense method:

As mentioned above, any attempt to attack Heracles and activating his Guts status Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. will give him a Special Defensive buff of the last attack type that killed him for 2 turns. If Heracles was killed by an Extra Attack, then he will be given a low Special Defense of all the types for the 2 turns.

1) The Best Offense is a good Defense: The Bazett Way

Utilizing Bazett can really help get traction against Heracles as her NP is a Counter-type mechanism to taking out his Guts Tooltip for 25px|link=ⓘThis effect is unremovable. at least 2-3 times when he attempts to attack her. This strategy is possible to pull this off with her NP lvl 1. The best way to use this strategy is to make sure on 1st turn, Bazett is given a full attack set with her attacking 4 times (Extra Attack), but try to prioritize using her Buster or Arts first before Quick attacks as we are relying on her NP (Quick attacks ) to deal as much damage to Heracles and you will find him stacking Quick Resistance a lot.

2) Combo with Attack > NP > Attack (Not Recommended, but maybe if paired with Bazette strat)

Whichever Servant you choose as your DPS main, make sure they are buffed well enough where their own single attack can take out as much as 201,000 Hp on Heracles, let alone a NP that does as much. This will help for at least the 1st 3 turns as he will be stacking the Special Defensive buffs, but this is not a good way to start since you need to keep constant pressure on Heracles, even delaying the turns will hurt if that DPS gets taken out soon.

Turtle it out; The Defense method:

If the Offense way seems impossible to accomplish, then utilizing a team built with defense buffs is the way to go. But for this strategy, there is the matter of timing when and what buffs to trigger before a certain number of turns have past. For Example, If planning to utilize Artoria Caster out on the field, you do not use her NP skill right Before turn 5, since Heracles will activate his Augeias' Stable labor that Removes effects with Buff Increase Defence ( , , . , / / ) on all enemies.

1) Utilize Defense compatibility changes and anti-purge Defense

There are certain ways for one to defend against Heracle's onslaught, but if you manage to pull this method off, then it shouldn't be much of a problem. One best method is to have Artoria Caster/Tamamo no Mae/Sima Yi (Reines) in the front row with CE's that increases NP rate increase or NP gain. Use all the skills available to stack defenses high. Should you have all their NP fully charged, use them immediatly and prioritize the order of using Reines → Castoria → Tamamo. This is because Reines NP can grant the party ignore defense class disadvantage for 3 turns, taking 1x damage from class disadvantage. briings them down This also helps reduces Heracles Berseker class damage rate of 1.5x -> 1.0x and also grants NP rate up and Removes any negative Debuff . Castoria is also there to keep her NP Anti-Purge Defense on the ready. The lastly, Tamamo's NP gives the team a good NP boost, making it a fair bit easier to access the other two Servant's NP and cool down all skill countdowns.

2) Cheapest Defense; Utilize Guts and Taunts

Not everyone realizes how valuable the low-tier Servants are when it comes to quest gimmicks or strategies. for those in the F2P mode and want to utilize what is available, there there is a way, but plan accordingly. Some Servants like Consort Yu (Lancer), Leonidas I, Georgios, and Musashibō Benkei have Taunt ability and Guts . You can also utilize Mashu for her Defense Buffs. Make use of these Servants and mayble utilize a Support like Ashiya Dōman, Kotomine, or Heracles for their multiple Guts skills, or have some extra defense buffs like Artoria Caster, Jeanne d'Arc, Himiko, Lady Avalon, or Merlin. Make sure some of the low-tier Servants are equiped with CE's with Invincibility or Guts status. This is unlikely to work, but play around with the strategy and it will surprise you how far you may get with the teams.
